definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: Coal tar has a strong smell and can stain clothing.
sentences.chinese: 煤焦油有很強烈的氣味，並且會染污衣服。

sentences.english: They will report on the experiments with coal tar.
sentences.chinese: 他們將彙報煤焦油的試驗情況。

sentences.english: Coal tar has been a historic contribution to modern organic chemical industry.
sentences.chinese: 煤焦油曾爲近代有機化工作出了歷史性貢獻。

sentences.english: Besides, the development mode of coal tar enterprises was also discussed.
sentences.chinese: 此外還討論了煤焦油加工企業的發展模式。

sentences.english: Thus, new technologies were suggested for coal tar processing to extract all kinds of valuable chemica…
sentences.chinese: 最後對我國煤焦油加工未來的發展提出了若干建議。

sentences.english: Any remaining tar is removed by passing the gas through an electrostatic precipitator .
sentences.chinese: 將煤氣通過靜電沉澱器以除去殘餘的煤焦油。

sentences.english: Factors influencing the properties of the coal tar enamels were discussed.
sentences.chinese: 討論了影響煤焦油磁漆性能的因素。

sentences.english: One byproduct he worked with was coal tar, which, when distilled, produced naphtha.
sentences.chinese: 其中一種廢料是煤焦油，經過蒸餾後可以得到輕油。

sentences.english: The process of coal tar steelmaking in special steel open hearth is described in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了特鋼平爐煤焦油鍊鋼工藝。

sentences.english: Coal tar spill pollutes Chongqin river.
sentences.chinese: 重慶煤焦油泄漏污染河流。

sentences.english: It's compatible with impregnating bitumen and coal tar enamel.
sentences.chinese: 與瀝青和煤焦油磁漆浸透良好。

definition: coking/the process of producing coke from coal
sodium carbonate Na2CO3/soda ash/same as 碳酸鈉|碳酸钠
